title: Understanding Dimensionality Reduction
text: Dimensionality reduction is a process used to reduce the number of random variables under consideration by obtaining a set of principal variables.

title: Preserving Variance
text: The technique aims to preserve as much variance as possible from the original dataset while reducing its dimensions.

title: Common Techniques
text: Some common techniques for dimensionality reduction include Principal Component Analysis (PCA), Linear Discriminant Analysis (LDA), and $$t-Distributed$$ Stochastic Neighbor Embedding $$(t-SNE)$$.

title: Focus on PCA
text: Principal Component Analysis (PCA) is a technique that transforms the original variables into a new set of variables, the principal components, which are uncorrelated and ordered by the amount of variance they capture from the data.

title: Select the Correct Term
text: The technique that reduces dimensionality while preserving as much variance as possible is Principal Component Analysis (PCA).
